intro: Eriocaulon brizoides, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grassy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its rhizomes help it spread and establish colonies in moist environments. Eriocaulon brizoides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
